question: {name} places {obj}s on the {surface} and {surface2}. Each {surface} can hold {x} {obj}s while each {surface2} can hold {mult} times that. {name} has {n} {obj}s, {k} {surface}s and {kk} {surface2}s. {name} then eats a third of the {obj}s. How many {obj}s won't he be able to place on the {surface}s or {surface2}s?
